Late Night Linux Discoveries

Discoveries from the Late Night Linux Podcast

Episode 161

Ceefax lives!

 https://www.nathanmediaservices.co.uk/teletext-viewer/

Interactive Viewer by genius Alistair Cree, a.k.a. ZXGuesser

Episode 161

HiFi Berry OS

 https://www.hifiberry.com/hifiberryos/

HiFiBerryOS is is our version of a minimal Linux distribution optimised for audio playback. The goal isn’t to add as much functionality as possible, but focus on music. We don’t think, you should have to deal with sample rates or file format, but focus on what’s really important: listening to music.

Episode 161

iPlayer probably runs on 32-bit Linux

 https://www.theregister.com/2022/01/17/bbc_iplayer_expires_2038/

403 forbidden. The Register apologises but your traffic appears to be tickling our robot sensors. If this problem persists, webmaster@theregister.co.uk

Episode 161

NimBLE ESP32

 https://github.com/h2zero/NimBLE-Arduino

A fork of the NimBLE library structured for compilation with Ardruino, designed for use with ESP32.
